head.title: Buying Tupperware Online Lets You Skip the Party

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Technology, Telecommunications and Internet

hedline.hl1: Buying Tupperware Online Lets You Skip the Party

block.p: Do you covet a Tupperware Egg-ceptional Server set (''a stylish server for deviled eggs and more'') but can't bear the thought of sitting through an actual Tupperware party to buy one? Tupperware now has a Web buying option. With a new service called My.Tupperware.com, you can do business with your neighborhood Tupperware representative while keeping your evenings free.

At the company's new site, 75,000 United States sales representatives can create personal home pages using preformatted designs. Besides listing Tupperware parties and Tupperware bingos, the personal pages can include Tupperware testimonials and recipes.

Tupperware now has a Web buying option. With a new service called My.Tupperware.com, you can do business with your neighborhood Tupperware representative while keeping your evenings free.

At the company's new site, 75,000 United States sales representatives can create personal home pages using preformatted designs. Besides listing Tupperware parties and Tupperware bingos, the personal pages can include Tupperware testimonials and recipes.
If users click through from the personal home pages to shop on Tupperware's corporate e-commerce site, the sales representative receives the usual 20 percent commission on everything they buy.

Tupperware is not giving up on its usual sales method. ''We're not looking to replace the party with anything else,'' said Christine Hanneman, the company's vice president for financial relations and treasury. ''We're looking to enhance it.''
